intro: Paronychia canadensis, commonly known as Canadian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and dunes. It has a slender, branching stem and small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Paronychia canadensis is an annual plant that blooms from June to August, contributing to the floral diversity of its native ecosystems.
